intro: Psychotria cornejoi, commonly known as the "Carnival Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that range from red to yellow, often with contrasting patterns. It typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in the canopy layer of the forest. Psychotria cornejoi is also noted for its aromatic leaves and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
